core_dl_geopoint.description: A 2D point location in latitude and longitude referenced to WGS 84 if not specified otherwise.

latitude.description: The latitude value in degrees of arc (dega). Value range [-90, 90].
latitude.title: Latitude

longitude.description: The longitude value in degrees of arc (dega). Value range [-180, 180]
longitude.title: Longitude

core_dl_geopoint.title: 2D Map Location

bbox.description: Bounding box in longitude, latitude WGS 84.

coordinates.description: Array of polygons (minimum 2D), containing an array of point coordinates (longitude, latitude, (optionally elevation and other properties).

geographicPosition.description: A position in the native geographic CRS (latitude and longitude) combined with an elevation from mean seal level (MSL)

crsKey.description: The 'crsKey', which can be looked up in the 'frameOfReference.crs' for further details.
crsKey.title: CRS Key

elevationFromMsl.description: Elevation from Mean Seal Level, downwards negative. The unit definition is found via 'elevationFromMsl.unitKey' in 'frameOfReference.units' dictionary.
elevationFromMsl.title: Elevation from MSL

latitude.description: Native or original latitude (unit defined by CRS)
latitude.title: Native Latitude

longitude.description: Native or original longitude (unit defined by CRS)
longitude.title: Native Longitude

geographicPosition.title: Geographic Position

legal.description: Legal meta data like legal tags, relevant other countries, legal status.

legaltags.description: The list of legal tags, see compliance API.
legaltags.title: Legal Tags

otherRelevantDataCountries.description: The list of other relevant data countries using the ISO 2-letter codes, see compliance API.
otherRelevantDataCountries.title: Other Relevant Data Countries

legal.title: Legal Meta Data

additionalProperties.description: An array of one or more entity references in the data lake.
additionalProperties.title: Link List

linkList.description: A named list of entities in the data lake as a dictionary item.
linkList.title: Link List

metaItem.description: A meta data item, which allows the association of named properties or property values to a Unit/Measurement/CRS/Azimuth/Time context.

kind.description: The kind of reference, unit, measurement, CRS or azimuth reference.
kind.title: Reference Kind

name.description: The name of the CRS or the symbol/name of the unit
example: NAD27 * OGP-Usa Conus / North Dakota South [32021,15851]
name.title: Name or Symbol

persistableReference.description: The persistable reference string uniquely identifying the CRS or Unit
persistableReference.title: Persistable Reference

propertyNames.description: The list of property names, to which this meta data item provides Unit/CRS context to. Data structures, which come in a single frame of reference, can register the property name, others require a full path like "data.structureA.propertyB" to define a unique context.
propertyNames.title: Attribute Names

propertyValues.description: The list of property values, to which this meta data item provides Unit/CRS context to. Typically a unit symbol is a value to a data structure; this symbol is then registered in this propertyValues array and the persistableReference provides the absolute reference.
propertyValues.title: Attribute Names

uncertainty.description: The uncertainty of the values measured given the unit or CRS unit.
uncertainty.title: Uncertainty

metaItem.title: Frame of Reference Meta Data Item

plssLocation.description: A location described by the Public Land Survey System (United States)

aliquotPart.description: A terse, hierarchical reference to a piece of land, in which successive subdivisions of some larger area.
aliquotPart.title: Aliquot Part

range.description: Range, also known as Rng, R; a measure of the distance east or west from a referenced principal meridian, in units of six miles.
range.title: Range

township.description: Township, also known as T or Twp; (1) Synonym for survey township, i.e., a square parcel of land of 36 square miles, or (2) A measure of the distance north or south from a referenced baseline, in units of six miles
township.title: Township

plssLocation.title: US PLSS Location

point3dNonGeoJson.description: A 3-dimensional point with a CRS key, which is further described in 'frameOfReference.crs' and a unitKey for the z or 3rd coordinate; the unit key is further described in 'frameOfReference.units'.

coordinates.description: 3-dimensional point; the first coordinate is typically pointing east (easting or longitude), the second coordinate typically points north (northing or latitude). The third coordinate is an elevation (upwards positive, downwards negative). The point's CRS is given by the container.
coordinates.title: 3D Point

crsKey.description: The 'crsKey', which can be looked up in the 'frameOfReference.crs' for further details.
crsKey.title: CRS Key

unitKey.description: The 'unitKey' for the 3rd coordinate, which can be looked up in the 'frameOfReference.unit' for further details.
unitKey.title: Unit Key

point3dNonGeoJson.title: 3D Point with CRS/Unit key

projectedPosition.description: A position in the native CRS in Cartesian coordinates combined with an elevation from mean seal level (MSL)

crsKey.description: The 'crsKey', which can be looked up in the 'frameOfReference.crs' for further details.
crsKey.title: CRS Key

elevationFromMsl.description: Elevation from Mean Seal Level, downwards negative. The unit definition is found via 'elevationFromMsl.unitKey' in 'frameOfReference.units' dictionary.
elevationFromMsl.title: Elevation from MSL

x.description: X-coordinate value in native or original projected CRS
x.title: X Coordinate

y.description: Y-coordinate value in native or original projected CRS
y.title: Y Coordinate

projectedPosition.title: Projected Position

definitiveTimeDepthRelation.description: The definitive tome-depth relation providing the MD to seismic travel-time transformation.
definitiveTimeDepthRelation.title: Definitive Time-Depth Relation

definitiveTrajectory.description: The definitive trajectory providing the MD to 3D space transformation.
definitiveTrajectory.title: Definitive Trajectory

tieInWellbore.description: The tie-in wellbore if this wellbore is a side-track.
tieInWellbore.title: Tie-in Wellbore

well.description: The well to which this wellbore belongs.
well.title: Well

simpleElevationReference.description: The entity's elevation reference, the elevation above MSL where vertical property is 0. Examples: MD==0, Elevation_Depth==0, TVD==0.

elevationFromMsl.description: The elevation above mean sea level (MSL), at which the vertical origin is 0.0. The 'unitKey' is further defined in 'frameOfReference.units'.
elevationFromMsl.title: Elevation from MSL

name.description: The name of the Elevation Reference.
name.title: Elevation Reference Name

simpleElevationReference.title: Simple Elevation Reference

additionalProperties.description: An array of one or more tag items, e.g. access control list tags, legal tags, etc.
additionalProperties.title: Tag Dictionary

tagDictionary.description: A tagged list of string arrays, e.g. access control list tags, legal tags, etc.
tagDictionary.title: Tag Dictionary

toManyRelationship.description: A relationship from this entity to many other entities either by natural key (name) or explicit id, optionally classified by confidence level.

confidences.description: The confidences of the relationships. Keep all the arrays ordered and aligned.
confidences.title: Relationship Confidences

ids.description: The ids of the related objects. It is populated for an explicit relationship where the target entity is present as a record in the data ecosystem. Keep all the arrays ordered and aligned.
ids.title: Related Object Id

names.description: The names or natural keys of the related objects. Keep all the arrays ordered and aligned.
names.title: Related Object Names

versions.description: The specific version numbers of the related instances. This is only specified if a specific version is required. If not populated the last version is implied. Keep all the arrays ordered and aligned.
versions.title: To Many Relationship

toOneRelationship.description: A relationship from this entity to one other entity either by natural key (name) or id, optionally classified by confidence level

confidence.description: The confidence of the relationship. If the property is absent a well-known relation is implied.
confidence.title: Relationship Confidence

id.description: The id of the related object in the Data Ecosystem. If set, the id has priority over the natural key in the name property.
id.title: Related Object Id

name.description: The name or natural key of the related object. This property is required if the target object id could not (yet) be identified.
name.title: Related Object Name

version.description: The version number of the related entity. If no version number is specified, the last version is implied.
version.title: Entity Version Number

toOneRelationship.title: To One Relationship

valueArrayWithUnit.description: Array of values associated with unit context. The 'unitKey' can be looked up in the 'frameOfReference.units'.

unitKey.description: Unit for the array values of the corresponding attribute for the domain object in question. The key can be looked up in the meta[] array under the root. It will be an array item with meta[i].kind == 'Unit' and meta[i].name == valueWithUnit.unitKey. The meta[i].propertyNames[] array will have to contain the name of the property including valueArrayWithUnit to enable the normalizer to act on it.
unitKey.title: Unit Key

values.description: Value of the corresponding attribute for the domain object in question.
values.title: Value

valueArrayWithUnit.title: Values with unitKey

valueWithUnit.description: Number value associated with unit context. The 'unitKey' can be looked up in the root property meta[] array.

unitKey.description: Unit for the value of the corresponding attribute for the domain object in question. The key can be looked up in the meta[] array under the root. It will be an array item with meta[i].kind == 'Unit' and meta[i].name == valueWithUnit.unitKey. The meta[i].propertyNames[] array will have to contain the name of the property including valueWithUnit to enable the normalizer to act on it.
unitKey.title: Unit Key

value.description: Value of the corresponding attribute for the domain object in question.
value.title: Value

valueWithUnit.title: Value with unitKey

wellboreData.description: The domain specific data container for a wellbore.

airGap.description: The gap between water surface and offshore drilling platform.
airGap.title: Air Gap

block.description: The block name, in which the wellbore is located.
block.title: Block

country.description: The country, in which the wellbore is located. The country name follows the convention in ISO 3166-1 'English short country name', see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1
country.title: Country

county.description: The county name, in which the wellbore is located.
county.title: County

dateCreated.description: The UTC date time of the entity creation
dateCreated.title: Creation Date and Time

dateModified.description: The UTC date time of the last entity modification
dateModified.title: Last Modification Date and Time

elevationReference.description: The wellbore's elevation reference from mean sea level (MSL), positive above MSL. This is where MD == 0 and TVD == 0
elevationReference.title: Elevation Reference

externalIds.description: An array of identities (e.g. some kind if URL to be resolved in an external data store), which links to external realizations of the same entity.
externalIds.title: Array of External IDs

field.description: The field name, to which the wellbore belongs.
field.title: Field

formationAtTd.description: The name of the formation at the wellbore's total depth.
formationAtTd.title: Formation at TD

formationProjected.description: The name of the formation at the wellbore's projected depth. This property is questionable as there is not precise documentation available.
formationProjected.title: Formation Projected

hasAchievedTotalDepth.description: True ("true" of "1") indicates that the wellbore has acheieved total depth. That is, drilling has completed. False ("false" or "0") indicates otherwise. Not given indicates that it is not known whether total depth has been reached.
hasAchievedTotalDepth.title: Has Total Depth Been Achieved Flag

isActive.description: True (="1" or "true") indicates that the wellbore is active. False (="0" or "false") indicates otherwise. It is the servers responsibility to set this value based on its available internal data (e.g., what objects are changing).
isActive.title: Is Active Flag

kickOffMd.description: The kick-off point in measured depth (MD); for the main well the kickOffMd is set to 0.
kickOffMd.title: Kick-off MD

kickOffTvd.description: Kickoff true vertical depth of the wellbore; for the main wellbore the kickOffMd is set to 0.
kickOffTvd.title: Kick-off MD

locationWGS84.description: A 2D GeoJSON FeatureCollection defining wellbore location or trajectory in WGS 84 CRS.
locationWGS84.title: Wellbore Shape WGS 84

permitNumber.description: The wellbore's permit number or permit ID.
permitNumber.title: Permit Number

plssLocation.description: A location described by the Public Land Survey System (United States)
plssLocation.title: US PLSS Location

propertyDictionary.description: A dictionary structure, i.e. key/string value pairs, to carry additional wellbore properties.
propertyDictionary.title: Property Dictionary

spudDate.description: The date and time when activities to drill the borehole begin to create a hole in the earth. For a sidetrack, this is the date kickoff operations began. The format follows ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DD extended format
spudDate.title: Spud Date

state.description: The state name, in which the wellbore is located.
state.title: State

totalDepthMd.description: The measured depth of the borehole. If status is plugged, indicates the maximum depth reached before plugging. It is recommended that this value be updated about every 10 minutes by an assigned raw data provider at a site.
totalDepthMd.title: Total MD

totalDepthMdDriller.description: The total depth along the wellbore as reported by the drilling contractor from 'elevationReference'. The unit definition is found via the property's unitKey' in 'frameOfReference.units' dictionary..
totalDepthMdDriller.title: Total MD Drilled

totalDepthMdPlanned.description: Planned measured depth for the wellbore total depth.
totalDepthMdPlanned.title: Total MD Planned

totalDepthMdSubSeaPlanned.description: Planned measured for the wellbore total depth - with respect to seabed.
totalDepthMdSubSeaPlanned.title: Total MD Sub Sea Planned

totalDepthProjectedMd.description: The projected total measured depth of the borehole. This property is questionable as there is not precise documentation available.
totalDepthProjectedMd.title: Total MD Projected

totalDepthTvd.description: The true vertical depth of the borehole. If status is plugged, indicates the maximum depth reached before plugging. It is recommended that this value be updated about every 10 minutes by an assigned raw data provider at a site.
totalDepthTvd.title: Total TVD

totalDepthTvdDriller.description: The total depth true vertical as reported by the drilling contractor from 'elevationReference', Downwards increasing. The unit definition is found via the property's unitKey' in 'frameOfReference.units' dictionary.
totalDepthTvdDriller.title: Total TVD Drilled

totalDepthTvdPlanned.description: Planned true vertical depth for the wellbore total depth.
totalDepthTvdPlanned.title: Total TVD Planned

totalDepthTvdSubSeaPlanned.description: Planned true vertical depth for the wellbore total depth - with respect to seabed.
totalDepthTvdSubSeaPlanned.title: Total TVD Sub Sea Planned

uwi.description: The unique wellbore identifier, aka. API number, US well number or UBHI. Codes can have 10, 12 or 14 digits depending on the availability of directional sidetrack (2 digits) and event sequence codes (2 digits).
uwi.title: Unique Wellbore Identifier

wellHeadElevation.description: The wellbore's vertical position is an elevation from mean sea level (MSL), positive above MSL.
wellHeadElevation.title: Well Head Elevation

wellHeadGeographic.description: The wellbore's well head position in the native, geographic CRS; vertical position is an elevation from mean sea level (MSL), positive above MSL.
wellHeadGeographic.title: Well Head Position, Geographic

wellHeadProjected.description: The wellbore's well head position in the native, projected CRS; vertical position is an elevation from mean sea level (MSL), positive above MSL.
wellHeadProjected.title: Well Head Position, Projected

wellHeadWgs84.description: The wellbore's position in WGS 84 latitude and longitude.
wellHeadWgs84.title: WGS 84 Position

wellboreData.title: Wellbore Data

description: The well-known wellbore schema. Used to capture the general information about a wellbore. This information is sometimes called a "wellbore header". A wellbore represents the path from surface to a unique bottomhole location. The wellbore object is uniquely identified within the context of one well object.

acl.description: The access control tags associated with this entity.
acl.title: Access Control List

ancestry.description: The links to data, which constitute the inputs.
ancestry.title: Ancestry

id.description: The unique identifier of the wellbore
id.title: Wellbore ID

meta.description: The meta data section linking the 'unitKey', 'crsKey' to self-contained definitions (persistableReference)
meta.title: Frame of Reference Meta Data

type.description: The reference entity type as declared in common:metadata:entity:*.
type.title: Entity Type

version.description: The version number of this wellbore; set by the framework.
version.title: Entity Version Number

title: Wellbore
